comment: She really just read off powerpoints and was very monotone in lecture videos. I taught myself using youtube and learning objectives. She's unnecessarily strict with webcam exams and throws around cheating allegations like its nothing. Be careful if you take her online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: I took her online lab over the summer so it's already a lot of information in a shortened amount of time. She was super accessible outside class and seemed to genuinely care about her students. She posted online lectures that were super helpful and was constantly sending out reminders for when things were due. I would take her again!

This was my first online lab, and I highly recommend this professor if you can't get into an in-person class. Very similar to the set up in anatomy 1, lab simulations were very interesting, and assignments were easy. When it came to her exams, review the labs simulations, PowerPoint, and use purposegames to study the models. 10/10

I took her for a&p 1 lab. She has TA's and mine was great. Shout out Ian burksss. Tests were pretty straight forward as long as you studied. My class was at 5 and usually studied from 9 am till class and passed with an A. It was rlly fun learning, def take her labs if you can.
Great teacher. I would take her again. Gives points back on exams.

Professor McGee was a great teacher who was clear about expectations. I would give this class a 4.5 only because she confused many of us in some lectures, but overall, she did a good job of providing clear lectures and PowerPoints. YOU HAVE TO STUDY! Her tests are more on PowerPoints and lectures, not stuff from the textbook. I def recommend her!
never even met her because we had a TA for lab. The TA was pretty chill. the lab exams were pretty easy if you just studied for them. Gave lots of study materials before the exam.

She made A&P not as hard as I thought it was going to be. As long as you study and know her powerpoints you should do fine on the tests. She records all her lectures so you can rewatch them if you miss a class, or before the exam. She also offers a lot of extra credit points. Her exams are pretty easy and is based mostly off her powerpoints.

I took the A&P I lab and she had a TA who I LOVEDD. It was a 5pm lab so she made it engaging since we were all ready to leave. I understood everything, if you wanted help very easy to ask. Clear how grades work, 3 exams, mainly lab assignments. Take her if you can, simple class.

You definitely need to study and do all the assignments, but Professor McGee was great. If you are looking for a professor who doesn't have hard tests, you probably should not be taking this class. All exams and quizzes are on lockdown, exams have webcams too. Do all the homework assignments and study learning objectives and you will be fine.

i had her online. 5 lockdown+camera exams. quizzes are lockdown browser. asynchronous. 3 mcgraw hill assignments with lots of questions and 2 D2L quizzes every week. manageable and easy to handle. she's great and also has a TA that offers 2 weekly study sessions via teams. shes a great prof that makes getting an A easy!
Anatomy 2 lab can be very difficult, but Prof Mcgee made it very enjoyable. She always made sure we felt comfortable asking questions and was aware how difficult the class can be.

She is very thorough during lectures and gives great resources for outside of class. She is a great teacher, but the tests are very long and you have to study well in order to succeed in this class. She will give points back to the class if a question was commonly missed.

I had BIOL 2251L with the Ian Burks (McGee had him teach this class but it was listed under her name). He is a good teacher. He is fun, caring, wants his class to succeed but also is all about getting all of us out of class sooner than later. Cool dude! One extra credit assignment, 3 exams each having little extra credit. I'd recommend McGee!

I had her for both lab and lecture. AP2 is a hard class no matter who you take- get ready to study. She by far is one of the best professors and wants all her students to do well. She is happy to go over anything with her students if they need help. Exams are hard but she prepares you well for them.

Great Professor! I recommend taking her. Her lectures go by super fast so you need to teach yourself a lot. Exams are passable. She does the in-class quizzes with you so you get 100 on in-class work and even homework due to unlimited attempts. Taker her.

AP 2 is hard overall but McGee provided a lot of useful resources when it came to exams. Her exams are very difficult. You need to make sure you know the information really well and that you're confident going into her exams. She doesn't take attendance but she does pop quizzes in lecture and goes through it with us which was very helpful for exams

Anatomy is a difficult subject, but McGee made it all understandable. You can tell that she cares a lot about her students and wants to help them succeed. As long as you listen to her lectures, do the homework, attend the SI sessions (if you need to), and study ahead of time, you will do fine.

Anatomy and Physiology 2 is not easy but McGee makes it as easy as it could be. If you take notes and listen in class. Studying for the test should not be bad. Her learning objectives listed are always whats on the test so you have a clear guideline on what to study. She is also very sweet and you can tell she cares about her students!

Great professor! Anatomy is a lot of material, so you definitely need to put the work in if you want to succeed. She had clear grading criteria and gave us back points on exams and extra credit opportunities when she could. Her tests are tough! Lots of matching and application, so you need to actually understand the material.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Anatomy 2 is a hard class in general but McGee is a good professor! It is important to work hard and you definitely have to do a lot of studying outside of class but she is available for office hours and she is understanding. She is strict and the tests are hard, but if you study you can definitely succeed!

Unfortunately, she seems to be approachable and understanding, but can be very rude and hypocritical to students. Her tests are pretty difficult, but she does supply you with the means to study and do well, it is just a very fast paced course and if you do not learn well from big lecture classes (like me) then you basically have to teach yourself.

one of the best! Amazing lectures and explained every concept thoroughly. She cared about her students that she gave them tips & tricks on how to pass AP2. A BUNCH OF EXTRA CREDITS. She gave a lot of practice questions for the exam. Exams were tough but it was everything she taught in class. You have to put in work and effort but it's worth it.

McGee was by far one of the best professors I've ever had. She cares very deeply about her students and you understanding the material. It is a content heavy class, so you need to develop good study skills. I personally think SI sessions (esp. major exam review), flashcards, and HW is all you need to pass. If you're confused, go to office hours.

Professor McGee was a fantastic professor and made A&P2 a very manageable class. There are 5 exams and the information taught in lecture is just as it appears on the exams. She goes through the slides fast because there is a ton of material, but she is frequently available outside of class. 10/10 would recommend.
Her tests were not awful, but they were very difficult since you have to put multiple steps in order. The homework is easy, and she cares about her students, but the class was very hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Very hard class because its anatomy, but very good professor. she cares about her students and their grades, as she gives multiple extra credit opportunities. However, lecture heavy and you definitely have to study a lot. Hw every week, but not hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: No need to scroll, McGee is as good as it gets for anatomy. I took her for anatomy 1 & 2 (2 lab also) and got an A in all three. Discover your successful study methods in the beginning, attend SIs, and pay attention in class, and youll be fine. Not an easy course, but McGee makes it less difficult.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Take ALL extra credit opportunities!! Her exams aren't too difficult if you study enough, and she always tries to work with the class. She's such a respectful and kind person too! This is a tough subject, but taking her makes it so much better
If you put in the work you will do just fine

McGee is an AMAZING professor! She genuinely cares for her students and is fair with grading. Often throws out test q's that high % of students missed and gives bonus for each test. Her powerpoints are the best tool to study for this class. Don't miss any hw on mastering bc they're a good grade boost - only need 70% accuracy for credit on them

A&P 1 is a hard class but she was very helpful. Shes caring and easily accessible outside of class. Tests were hard but SI sessions helped and she gave out some extra credit assignments so make sure to keep up with the deadlines. Overall a really good professor. Highly recommend! Take her class if possible!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor McGee is amazing. This is a hard class and will require a lot of effort on your part to pass the class. She gives ample opportunities for extra credit and her test questions come straight from her power points. I took this class in the summer and going into the final have a high A. Take her, she wants you to succeed but you have to work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor McGee is truly amazing. She understood that this was not an easy class and always gave chances for people to improve their grades. There were a lot of in class assignments that she went over before we turned it in. She also gave extra credit after every test so that it could be added to our test score. It was one of my favorite classes.

Dr. McGee was for sure better than other BIOL professors I've had. She didn't just regurgitate information from the textbook, whcih I appreciated. Rather, she used fun and creative ideas to help us remember hard information. She also elaborated on topics and explained everything. Tests were hard but SI was super helpful. 2 HWs every unit. Take her.

Mrs. McGee was awesome! She always made time to communicate with students outside of class and gave so much extra credit throughout the semester. This is a tough course, but if you put in the time to study properly then you will definitely receive an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is extremely clear on what's expected out of your work and is very willing to answer questions/help in anyway needed. The assignments were not too hard, they were fair. Overall she was a great professor and I enjoyed her lab class.

Loved this professor. She was super helpful when giving us assignments and would walk us though every little thing which I really liked. It made doing labs so much easier. I 10/10 recommend. She got straight to the point and the class was an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Highly recommend!!!!! P. McGee is amazing at what she does. Anatomy is hard and you have to put in a lot of time to study, but she makes the class as bearable as it can be. LOTS of extra credit and she is always available for questions. Take her!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: P. McGee is a very caring teacher, but is very strict when it comes to tests. Her test are based off her PowerPoints, which come straight out of the book in my opinion. So if you read the book and study the PowerPoints you should be good. She gives lots of extra credit. A lot of studying is involved. Overall shes is amazing! Take her if you can.
One of the best professors you could have. She is clear about what she expects from you. She is understanding and caring. Also she replies really fast to emails, and is good at explaining.
Prof McGee is the sweetest teacher I've had! She explains things so well and gives lots of extra credit opportunities. 10/10 recommend taking her!!

I love Prof McGee! She is super caring and wants the best for her students. Great lectures! Provides great resources for practice on the material. Opportunities for extra credit. Unit homework due day of each exam. Highly recommend!

By far one of the best professors at KSU. She really cares about her students' grades and wants them to do well. Super helpful and offers so many resources. Anatomy is not an easy class but she makes it so much more digestible. Super sweet and ready to answer any questions you may have. 4 tests, final, hw, extra credit. TAKE HER!

Professor McGee is one of the few professors that i have had that love their job. She shows up everyday in a great mood and is ready to teach. She uses a lot of real life examples and analogies that makes the material stick in your head. She is my favorite bio teacher ive ever had.

She was a nice lady and super understanding but not the best lecturer, I basically just taught myself by reading the book and studying the powerpoints. She gives alot of extra credit too which is a plus. Just be prepared to study alot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the nicest professors at KSU. You can tell she really cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. That said, there is a lot to memorize for this course, so don't expect an easy A. She offers lots of opportunities for points, including extra credit, so that helped a lot. I definitely recommend Prof. McGee.

I seriously love Prof. McGee, Im gonna miss her so much. I took her for both A&P labs! She is so helpful and kind, she explains the material so well and she provided extra credit when we needed it. She really cares about her students and made an effort to make a connection with us even during the pandemic over collaborate. Please take her!

Professor Mcgee is amazing & I would take her again! She really wants her students to grasp the concepts and succeed in her class and in your future career. Anatomy can be rigorous, and you have to work for your A but she is there to help (extra credit opportunities, available outside of class, assignments/questions directly from lab manual/ppts)
Such a great teacher. She was super concerned and so helpful in understanding a complex topic. Would definitely recommended.

The BEST professor I have ever had! Replies to emails quickly, explains clearly, 70% Hw needed for a 100% hw grade so we can learn from mistakes, takes responsibility, and is extremely fair. Anatomy isn't easy and you still have to work for your grade but she is such a lovely professor. I took her for lab and lecture and she is so understanding.

McGee is the most genuinely caring professors I've ever taken. She recognizes when her tests are too difficult (high fail rate) and offers extra credit. Her tests are hard, but only because the subject itself is hard. As long as you do the homework, study a few days before the tests, and do the in class quizzes, you should pass.

Exams had absolutely nothing to do with homework. Lectures were word vomit for a solid hour and a half. She would only give lockdown browser for half the class and thought that was fair and that the other half was honest. Only take this class if you want to study every night to even pass. Mandatory break out session quizzes during every class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Love her! Mrs. McGee always did her best to help students understand. Took during the pandemic and she would stay online after class to review or answer questions. 4 tests and a final, homework due before each exam and is a great study tool. Mrs. McGee is funny and will start the lectures asking how we're doing. She wants to see you succeed!!

She is an amazing professor! She legitimately cares about her students and wants them to succeed. She teaches you both the material and how to learn, tailoring to multiple learning styles. The tests are very similar to the material she covers on her slides and in class.
My favorite professor Ive ever had! She actually cares that you do well in her class unlike others! I usually dont write reviews, but TAKE HER TAKE HER TAKE HER!!!!

Anatomy is a tough class as is, but she makes it easier. I love the way she explains the information. There are 5 exams and pearson homework, with some extra credit. Tests come directly from the powerpoint, but you still have to really know your information to do well on them. I loved having her because she really cares about her students.

Anatomy II was AWESOME! Absolutely fascinating! Professor McGee is the best! She is so kind and wants her students to succeed. Know her PowerPoints inside and out, and you will do great! PLEASE take her! Also, I give this class a 4.0 difficulty not because of how hard the class is but because of the amount of material that must be memorized.

I also had her in 2221 and 2222L. She is simply an amazing professor. She presents information in many ways, such as pictures, words, and videos. She also provides plenty of extra credit opportunities to practice the material. She wants you to learn the material and do well not only in the class but also in your future.

Very sweet and very knowledgeable, explains complicated concepts clearly and is very patient with questions and review. Took her for lecture and lab and would recommend her for both. Tests were not easy but not impossible either. Gets off topic every lecture though, which can make it hard to stay focused. Practice quizzes for extra credit

Professor McGee is the best professor I've EVER had. She cares so much and will help you achieve your goal. She is fair and very knowledgeable in this subject. If you do your part, you will get an easy A. I would take her a million times over. Really can't explain how wonderful she is.
Love Traci. This woman is awesome. She is not only knowledgable about A&P but knows how to teach. She is kind and fair. I would highly suggest taking her class.

This is for the Lab section! The lab is quite a great deal harder than lecture, despite this Mcgee makes it much easier than it should be, she gives extra credit and will help you with anything that is even slightly confusing. If the majority of the class misses something it will get thrown out! She is very caring and personable will work with you!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Mcgee is the best professor I have ever had. She cares about everyone in her class and works hard to make sure everyone understands the material. She sets up times to meet before or after classes to ensure success, if you go to these she will practically tell you exactly what is on the test. Extra credit, Amazing Lecture, Funny Stories.

Best professor Ive had at KSU thus far. Gives you plenty of extra material that will suit your learning style. Always readily available whether that be in class or over email. One of the only professors who actually wants you to succeed rather than making the class extra hard. Taking her again spring semester she is so good!

She's an amazing teacher that wants to see you succeed. She gives out 5 extra credit opportunities worth 10 points each but they are given out randomly throughout the semester. She cares so much about her students and is willing to meet you if you need extra help. She is one of the best teachers at KSU.

Professor McGee is one of the best professors I've taken at KSU. She teaches very clearly, especially for A&P. Very good at breaking down the dense content. She have extra credit throughout the semester so you'll wanna be in class

Professor McGee is the best professor I have ever had. She is extremely knowledgeable and she really wants you to succeed in class. This class has some tough material but it is manageable and she makes it even easier by giving you all the help and resources you need. I would absolutely take her again!

Mcgee is one of the best professors I have had. The class is difficult, lots of memorization and concepts but she provides you with plenty of material to learn it suited for your learning style. study powerpoints!! Tests are kind of difficult but she is always willing to meet with you to explain more. She is a teacher that wants you to succeed.
